member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellCommand
member.summary: This class provides identifies shell context menu commands that are to be executed or that the user has chosen. A command is represented by a string or a value - they are assignment compatible. A ShellCommand also has a property "Caption" that stores the localized caption of a menu item the user has chosen. It is however not possible to create a command from a caption.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder
member.summary: ShellFolder values provide a unique system-independent way to identify special folders used frequently by applications, but which may not have the same name or location on any given system.
member.remarks: Known folder constants begin with 0x0050

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AdminTools
member.summary: The file system directory that is used to store administrative tools for an individual user. The Microsoft Management Console (MMC) will save customized consoles to this directory, and it will roam with the user.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AllTasks
member.summary: The "All Tasks" folder, a collection of control panel tasks. Note that bitness of calling application and OS must match to show control panel items. Ensure application is targeted architecture "Any CPU"!

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AltStartup
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's nonlocalized Startup program group.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AppData
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data. This CSIDL is supported by the redistributable Shfolder.dll for systems that do not have the Microsoft Internet Explorer 4.0 integrated Shell installed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AppUpdates
member.summary: The virtual folder containing the installed application updates.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.BitBucket
member.summary: The virtual folder containing the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CDBurnArea
member.summary: The file system directory acting as a staging area for files waiting to be written to CD. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data\Microsoft\CD Burning.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonAdminTools
member.summary: The file system directory containing administrative tools for all users of the computer.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonAltStartup
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the nonlocalized Startup program group for all users. Valid only for Microsoft Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonAppData
member.summary: The file system directory containing application data for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonDesktopDirectory
member.summary: The file system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonDocuments
member.summary: The file system directory that contains documents that are common to all users. A typical paths is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents. Valid for Windows NT systems and Microsoft Windows 95 and Windows 98 systems with Shfolder.dll installed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonFavorites
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for favorite items common to all users. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonMusic
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for music files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonPictures
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for image files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonPrograms
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonStartmenu
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs and folders that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonStartup
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonTemplates
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the templates that are available to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Templates. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonVideo
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for video files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ComputersNearMe
member.summary: The folder representing other computers in your workgroup.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Connections
member.summary: The virtual folder representing Network Connections, containing network and dial-up connections.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Contacts
member.summary: The virtual folder containing the users contacts.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Controls
member.summary: The virtual folder containing icons for the Control Panel applications.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Cookies
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Cookies.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Desktop
member.summary: The virtual folder representing the Windows desktop, the root of the namespace.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.DesktopDirectory
member.summary: The file system directory used to physically store file objects on the desktop (not to be confused with the desktop folder itself). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Desktop.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Documents
member.summary: The users documents folder. Equivalent to Personal

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.DocumentsLibrary
member.summary: The documents library.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Downloads
member.summary: The downloads folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Drives
member.summary: The virtual folder representing This PC (My Computer), containing everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel. The folder may also contain mapped network drives.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Favorites
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorite items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Favorites.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Fonts
member.summary: A virtual folder containing fonts. A typical path is C:\Windows\Fonts.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Games
member.summary: The games folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.History
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Homegroup
member.summary: The home group, only on Windows 7 and later.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Internet
member.summary: A virtual folder for Internet Explorer (icon on desktop).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.InternetCache
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Temporary Internet Files.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Libraries
member.summary: The libraries folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Links
member.summary: The folder %USERPROFILE%\Links.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.LocalAppData
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a data repository for local (nonroaming) applications. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.LocalAppDataLow
member.summary: The LocalLow folder of the users appdata - %USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MusicLibrary
member.summary: The music library.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MyMusic
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for music files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\User\My Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MyPictures
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for image files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MyVideo
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for video files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Nethood
member.summary: A file system directory containing the link objects that may exist in the My Network Places virtual folder. It is not the same as CSIDL_NETWORK, which represents the network namespace root. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\NetHood.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Network
member.summary: A virtual folder representing Network Neighborhood, the root of the network namespace hierarchy.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.OneDrive
member.summary: The OneDrive folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Personal
member.summary: The file system directory used to physically store a user's common repository of documents. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents. This should be distinguished from the virtual My Documents folder in the namespace.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.PicturesLibrary
member.summary: The pictures library.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Printers
member.summary: The virtual folder containing installed printers.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Printhood
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the link objects that can exist in the Printers virtual folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\PrintHood.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Profile
member.summary: The user's profile folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username. Applications should not create files or folders at this level; they should put their data under the locations referred to by or .

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFiles
member.summary: The Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesCommon
member.summary: A folder for components that are shared across applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common. Valid only for Windows NT, Windows 2000, and Windows XP systems. Not valid for Windows Millennium Edition (Windows Me).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesCommonX64
member.summary: This value is not supported on 32-bit operating systems. It also is not supported for 32-bit applications running on 64-bit operating systems. Attempting to use it in either situation results in an error.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesCommonX86
member.summary: A folder for components that are shared across applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common. Valid only for Windows NT, Windows 2000, and Windows XP systems. Not valid for Windows Millennium Edition (Windows Me).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesX64
member.summary: This value is not supported on 32-bit operating systems. It also is not supported for 32-bit applications running on 64-bit operating systems. Attempting to use it in either situation results in an error.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesX86
member.summary: The Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Programs
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the user's program groups (which are themselves file system directories). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Public
member.summary: The %PUBLIC% folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.PublicDownloads

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.QuickAccess

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Recent

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_READ
member.summary: Indicates that the object is read-only, meaning that modifications cannot be made. For example, if a stream object is opened with STGM_READ, the ISequentialStream::Read method may be called, but the ISequentialStream::Write method may not. Similarly, if a storage object opened with STGM_READ, the IStorage::OpenStream and IStorage::OpenStorage methods may be called, but the IStorage::CreateStream and IStorage::CreateStorage methods may not.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_WRITE
member.summary: Enables you to save changes to the object, but does not permit access to its data. The provided implementations of the IPropertyStorage and IPropertySetStorage interfaces do not support this write-only mode.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_READWRITE
member.summary: Enables access and modification of object data. For example, if a stream object is created or opened in this mode, it is possible to call both IStream::Read and IStream::Write. Be aware that this constant is not a simple binary OR operation of the STGM_WRITE and STGM_READ elements.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_DENY_NONE
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent openings of the object are not denied read or write access. If no flag from the sharing group is specified, this flag is assumed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_DENY_READ
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in STGM_READ mode. It is typically used on a root storage object.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object for STGM_WRITE or STGM_READWRITE access. In transacted mode, sharing of STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE or STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE can significantly improve performance because they do not require snapshots.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in any mode. Be aware that this value is not a simple bitwise OR operation of the STGM_SHARE_DENY_READ and STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE values. In transacted mode, sharing of STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE or STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE can significantly improve performance because they do not require snapshots.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_PRIORITY
member.summary: Opens the storage object with exclusive access to the most recently committed version. Thus, other users cannot commit changes to the object while you have it open in priority mode. You gain performance benefits for copy operations, but you prevent others from committing changes. Limit the time that objects are open in priority mode. You must specify STGM_DIRECT and STGM_READ with priority mode, and you cannot specify STGM_DELETEONRELEASE. STGM_DELETEONRELEASE is only valid when creating a root object, such as with StgCreateStorageEx. It is not valid when opening an existing root object, such as with StgOpenStorageEx. It is also not valid when creating or opening a subelement, such as with IStorage::OpenStorage.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_CREATE
member.summary:
Indicates that an existing storage object or stream should be removed before the new object replaces it. A new object is created when this flag is specified only if the existing object has been successfully removed. This flag is used when attempting to create:
A storage object on a disk, but a file of that name exists. An object inside a storage object, but a object with the specified name exists. A byte array object, but one with the specified name exists.
This flag cannot be used with open operations, such as StgOpenStorageEx or IStorage::OpenStream.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_CONVERT
member.summary: Creates the new object while preserving existing data in a stream named "Contents". In the case of a storage object or a byte array, the old data is formatted into a stream regardless of whether the existing file or byte array currently contains a layered storage object. This flag can only be used when creating a root storage object. It cannot be used within a storage object; for example, in IStorage::CreateStream. It is also not valid to use this flag and the STGM_DELETEONRELEASE flag simultaneously.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_FAILIFTHERE
member.summary: Causes the create operation to fail if an existing object with the specified name exists. In this case, STG_E_FILEALREADYEXISTS is returned. This is the default creation mode; that is, if no other create flag is specified, STGM_FAILIFTHERE is implied.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_DIRECT
member.summary: Indicates that, in direct mode, each change to a storage or stream element is written as it occurs. This is the default if neither STGM_DIRECT nor STGM_TRANSACTED is specified.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_TRANSACTED
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, changes are buffered and written only if an explicit commit operation is called. To ignore the changes, call the Revert method in the IStream, IStorage, or IPropertyStorage interface. The COM compound file implementation of IStorage does not support transacted streams, which means that streams can be opened only in direct mode, and you cannot revert changes to them, however transacted storages are supported. The compound file, stand-alone, and NTFS file system implementations of IPropertySetStorage similarly do not support transacted, simple property sets because these property sets are stored in streams. However, transactioning of nonsimple property sets, which can be created by specifying the PROPSETFLAG_NONSIMPLE flag in the grfFlags parameter of IPropertySetStorage::Create, are supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_NOSCRATCH
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, a temporary scratch file is usually used to save modifications until the Commit method is called. Specifying STGM_NOSCRATCH permits the unused portion of the original file to be used as work space instead of creating a new file for that purpose. This does not affect the data in the original file, and in certain cases can result in improved performance. It is not valid to specify this flag without also specifying STGM_TRANSACTED, and this flag may only be used in a root open. For more information about NoScratch mode, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_NOSNAPSHOT
member.summary: This flag is used when opening a storage object with STGM_TRANSACTED and without STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE or STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE. In this case, specifying STGM_NOSNAPSHOT prevents the system-provided implementation from creating a snapshot copy of the file. Instead, changes to the file are written to the end of the file. Unused space is not reclaimed unless consolidation is performed during the commit, and there is only one current writer on the file. When the file is opened in no snapshot mode, another open operation cannot be performed without specifying STGM_NOSNAPSHOT. This flag may only be used in a root open operation. For more information about NoSnapshot mode, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SIMPLE
member.summary: Provides a faster implementation of a compound file in a limited, but frequently used, case. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_DIRECT_SWMR
member.summary: Supports direct mode for single-writer, multireader file operations. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_DELETEONRELEASE
member.summary: Indicates that the underlying file is to be automatically destroyed when the root storage object is released. This feature is most useful for creating temporary files. This flag can only be used when creating a root object, such as with StgCreateStorageEx. It is not valid when opening a root object, such as with StgOpenStorageEx, or when creating or opening a subelement, such as with IStorage::CreateStream. It is also not valid to use this flag and the STGM_CONVERT flag simultaneously.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.WTS_ALPHATYPE
member.summary: Indicates whether a bitmap has an alpha channel.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The bitmap is an unknown format. The Shell tries nonetheless to detect whether the image has an alpha channel.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_RGB
member.summary: The bitmap is an RGB image without alpha. The alpha channel is invalid and the Shell ignores it.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_ARGB
member.summary: The bitmap is an ARGB image with a valid alpha channel.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IShellFolder2.GetDetailsEx(System.IntPtr,Jam.Shell.SHCOLUMNID@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Gets detailed information, identified by a property set identifier (FMTID) and a property identifier (PID), on an item in a Shell folder.
member.param: A PIDL of the item, relative to the parent folder. This method accepts only single-level PIDLs. The structure must contain exactly one SHITEMID structure followed by a terminating zero. This value cannot be NULL.
A pointer to an SHCOLUMNID structure that identifies the column.

A pointer to a VARIANT with the requested information. The value is fully typed. The value returned for properties from the property system must conform to the type specified in that property definition's typeInfo as the legacyType attribute.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.Initialize(System.IntPtr,Jam.Shell.RECT@,Jam.Shell.Com.FolderSettings@)
member.summary: Prepares the browser to be navigated.
member.param: A handle to the owner window or control.

A pointer to a RECT containing the coordinates of the bounding rectangle the browser will occupy. The coordinates are relative to hwndParent. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetRect should subsequently be called.

A pointer to a FOLDERSETTINGS structure that determines how the folder will be displayed in the view. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetFolderSettings should be called, otherwise, the default view settings for the folder are used.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.Destroy
member.summary: Destroys the browser.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.SetRect(System.IntPtr@,Jam.Shell.RECT)
member.summary: Sets the size and position of the view windows created by the browser.
member.param: A pointer to a DeferWindowPos handle. This paramater can be NULL.
The coordinates that the browser will occupy.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.SetPropertyBag(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the name of the property bag.
member.param: A pointer to a constant, null-terminated, Unicode string that contains the name of the property bag. View state information that is specific to the application of the client is stored (persisted) using this name.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.SetEmptyText(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the default empty text.
member.param: A pointer to a constant, null-terminated, Unicode string that contains the empty text.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.SetFolderSettings(Jam.Shell.Com.FolderSettings@)

member.param: A pointer to a FOLDERSETTINGS structure that contains the folder settings to be applied.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.Advise(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Initiates a connection with IExplorerBrowser for event callbacks.
member.param: A pointer to the IExplorerBrowserEvents interface of the object to be advised of IExplorerBrowser events
When this method returns, contains a token that uniquely identifies the event listener. This allows several event listeners to be subscribed at a time.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.Unadvise(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Terminates an advisory connection.
member.param: A connection token previously returned from IExplorerBrowser::Advise. Identifies the connection to be terminated.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.SetOptions(Jam.Shell.ExplorerBrowserOptions)

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.GetOptions(Jam.Shell.ExplorerBrowserOptions@)
member.summary: Gets the current browser options.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the current EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS for the browser.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.ShellApi.NativeMethods.GetLongPathName(System.String,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The GetLongPathName API call is only available on Windows 98/ME and Windows 2000/XP. It is not available on Windows 95 & NT. The file must exist to get the correct path. member.name: M:Jam.Shell.ShellApi.NativeMethods.ImageList_DrawEx(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

Background color of the image.
Foreground color of the image.
Drawing style and, optionally, the overlay image.
member.returns: Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.
